intro: Henckelia doryphylla, commonly known as the slender leaf hibiscus, is a species of flowering plant in the Malvaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its narrow, elongated leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Henckelia doryphylla is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage and blooms.
